title: SIIG 10 Port 150W USB Charging Station with Qi Wireless Charging Deck, 6X USB-A and 4X USB-C Charging Ports, Vertical Device Organizer, Compatible with iPhones, iPads and More (AC-PW1R11-S1) Black 150W (6A4C) + Qi
description: CHARGE AND ORGANIZE: With 6x USB-A and 4x USB-C ports, power and charge 10 electronic devices simultaneously while keeping your desk clean and clutter free. USB cables are NOT included.
top_reviews:
[{"id":"R2CITLPTB3BMTI","title":"Game changer.","body":"My wife and I decided we did not want to keep our phones in our room anymore and wanted a charging station we could set up in our living room. At first I was skeptical about it because of its light weight, but it’s definitely a quality product. The design makes it easy to set your devices up for charging and charges them quickly, it definitely has enough ports for our family for multiple devices. We’ve definitely enjoyed it and use it all the time. Read more","asin":"B0B7NLB8NT","body_html":"
My wife and I decided we did not want to keep our phones in our room anymore and wanted a charging station we could set up in our living room.

At first I was skeptical about it because of its light weight, but it’s definitely a quality product. The design makes it easy to set your devices up for charging and charges them quickly, it definitely has enough ports for our family for multiple devices. We’ve definitely enjoyed it and use it all the time.

Construction appears durable. One star removed because I feel that the USB-C ports amperage should be made more obvious. Be aware that the USB-C port is only 3 amp... expect slow charging from that individual port. All other USB-A are full speed (individually), however, expect slightly slower charging rates/speeds as more devices are connected to the unit. The dividers are solid and non-removable. I wish the wireless \"dock/pad\" area had a more grippy surface...my LG V35 doesn't slide while on the dock, per se, but if I interact/touch the phone (no case) it does spin very easily. Using the Android app \"Ampere\", my charging rate from the wireless dock is roughly 750 mA give or take. So I think the wattage for the wireless dock is between 5 and 10. Oddly, another phone with wireless charging capability has had problems with constant interrupted wireless charging. It is a LG Optimus G Pro from way back in 2013. I cannot fault this SIIG unit, however, due to the age of that phone... it's an odd issue. I did contact the seller regarding the amperage of the USB-C port and the seller was very quick to respond. The misunderstanding concerning the USB-C port was my fault, I should have read the product specs more clearly. Overall this is a great dock and very handy. Read more","asin":"B0B7NLB8NT","body_html":"
Have had this product for over a month now, great product overall. Construction appears durable. One star removed because I feel that the USB-C ports amperage should be made more obvious. Be aware that the USB-C port is only 3 amp... expect slow charging from that individual port. All other USB-A are full speed (individually), however, expect slightly slower charging rates/speeds as more devices are connected to the unit. The dividers are solid and non-removable.

I wish the wireless "dock/pad" area had a more grippy surface...my LG V35 doesn't slide while on the dock, per se, but if I interact/touch the phone (no case) it does spin very easily. Using the Android app "Ampere", my charging rate from the wireless dock is roughly 750 mA give or take. So I think the wattage for the wireless dock is between 5 and 10. Oddly, another phone with wireless charging capability has had problems with constant interrupted wireless charging. It is a LG Optimus G Pro from way back in 2013. I cannot fault this SIIG unit, however, due to the age of that phone... it's an odd issue.

I did contact the seller regarding the amperage of the USB-C port and the seller was very quick to respond. The misunderstanding concerning the USB-C port was my fault, I should have read the product specs more clearly.

Overall this is a great dock and very handy.
Read more

It was now covered in devices. Remote controls, chargers, cables, iphones, androids, etc. There had to be a way to manage this mess. I started by getting a brick that could charge 4 USB (one C). That helped eliminate some chargers. Then realized you could get 1 foot cords for lightning and micro USB, which cleaned up a lot of cable mess. Still a problem was how many devices were just laying around. I started looking on Amazon for a docking station and found several. Some didn't look all that strong enough to hold my 12.9\" iPad Pro with case. I thought I could build an organizer but I'm already out of chargers. So I found this SIIG. It's a little thicker than what I would like but it fits the bill. The wireless charging works great and so does all the slots for holding the devices. The only thing that I would like better is that the USB C port could charge at least 65 watts (it's only 15). It is fantastic and would recommend it. Read more","asin":"B0B7NLB8NT","body_html":"
I knew I was running into a problem when I had no room for my tea cup on my light stand. It was now covered in devices. Remote controls, chargers, cables, iphones, androids, etc. There had to be a way to manage this mess. I started by getting a brick that could charge 4 USB (one C). That helped eliminate some chargers. Then realized you could get 1 foot cords for lightning and micro USB, which cleaned up a lot of cable mess. Still a problem was how many devices were just laying around. I started looking on Amazon for a docking station and found several. Some didn't look all that strong enough to hold my 12.9" iPad Pro with case. I thought I could build an organizer but I'm already out of chargers. So I found this SIIG. It's a little thicker than what I would like but it fits the bill.
The wireless charging works great and so does all the slots for holding the devices. The only thing that I would like better is that the USB C port could charge at least 65 watts (it's only 15).
It is fantastic and would recommend it.
Read more
